meanings.definition: The quality of being wary and unwilling to take risks.
meanings.sent1: Her circumspection in financial matters saved her from falling into debt.
meanings.sent2: It is important to approach unfamiliar situations with circumspection.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel showed circumspection when deciding whether to approach the new bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His circumspection was like a shield protecting him from hasty decisions.
meanings.sent5: The circumspection of the detective helped solve the mysterious case.

meanings.definition: Careful consideration of all possible consequences before taking action.
meanings.sent1: The student's circumspection before choosing a college major paid off in the long run.
meanings.sent2: Always practice circumspection before making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's circumspection before pouncing on the toy mouse was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her circumspection was a beacon of wisdom in a sea of impulsiveness.
meanings.sent5: The circumspection of the captain saved the ship from disaster.
